title: Syria's new army confronts the legacy of civil war
subhead: 'Syria after Assad' (4/4). The new volunteer army, structured by the country's transitional authorities, has struggled to integrate the various military factions that have emerged from the conflict during Bashar al-Assad's dictatorship.

title: 'Clair Obscur: Expedition 33' sweeps nine Game Awards
subhead: The French studio Sandfall Interactive won a record number of awards at the American ceremony, known as the video game equivalent of the Oscars.

title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

The actor and rape accusations behind Brigitte Macron's 'stupid bitches' remark
subhead: France's first lady made headlines with her comments about feminist activists who disrupted a performance of the comedian Ary Abittan. They were contesting the dropping of rape charges against him earlier this year. Le Monde reviewed the ruling and spoke to the plaintiff.

title: Trapped by old treaties with Russia, Europeans face threat of heavy financial penalties
subhead: A new report warns of the significant risk facing the European Union due to arbitration proceedings launched by Russian oligarchs and companies targeted by sanctions.

title: How the Israeli army is razing the part of Gaza it is supposed to withdraw from
subhead: Despite the ceasefire that was declared on October 10, Israel has continued to raze many buildings east of the 'yellow line' in the Gaza Strip, according to local residents and satellite images of the enclave.
